channel.title: Automated events

item.title: Automated events
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

Apart from keeping the source tidy, as base rscd stands there isn’t a difference in how taxing on the processor either method is, as in both methods they’re checked to see whether they should run on every engine rotation. One bonus to 'imthenull’s method however is not using an anonymous inner class…but that’s of course my opinion as I don’t particularly like seeing class$1$2$…

*If you’re using a single thread (base rscd)

Read full topic

Why not use events?

		eventHandler.add(new DelayedEvent(null, 60000) { // change 60000ms to what you want.
			public void run() {
				//Whatever you want to do every 1min
			}
		});

above

                while (running) {
                        long curTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

[/quote]

no. mine is better.[/quote]
Like xEnt sayed no it’s not.

item.title: Automated events
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Hello, its been a while, i know… lol anyway. i was fooling around this morning, learning stuff etc. Anywho. I made a automated event system, its basic and does nothing but display a message, ill let you decide what to put in it.

First off i used this on NOOBScape v3.

open up your GameEngine class and find

	private void processClients() {

right above that add this in.

private long lastEvent = System.currentTimeMillis(); /** *Automated Event System *By Hikilaka */ private void startEvent() { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastEvent > 60000 * 60) { Logger.print("Starting automated event!", 3); long now = System.currentTimeMillis(); lastEvent = now; } }

then search for

while (running) { long curTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

and underneath that add this

startEvent();

This will display “Starting automated event!” every hour. to change how fast is does this look at if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastEvent > 60000 * 60) {

Thanks rate/hate!!!

EDIT i’ve updated this more, except its bugged. [code] private long lastEvent = System.currentTimeMillis();;
/**
*Automated Event System
*By Hikilaka
*/
private void checkEvent() {
if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastEvent > 20000) {
startEvent();
}
}

private void startEvent() {
	Logger.print("Starting automated event!", 3);
	World.WarEventStarted();
	World.sendToAll("@gre@Server: @whi@An automated war event has been started!");
	World.sendToAll("@gre@Server: @whi@Type ::joinevent to join!");
	long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
	lastEvent = now;
}

private void endEvent() {
	Logger.print("Ending the automated event.");
	World.WarEventEnd();
	World.sendToAll("@gre@Server: @whi@Entry to the event war has been closed.");
	long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
	lastEvent = now;
}[/code]

i cant get it to end after said seconds… anyone help?

Read full topic
